intro: Anemonoides udensis, commonly known as the lesser anemone, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the Ranunculaceae family, characterized by its showy, often brightly colored flowers. The plant features palmately divided, lobed leaves that are typically hairy and arranged alternately along the stem. Its flowers are usually white or pale pink, with numerous stamens surrounding a central pistil. Anemonoides udensis thrives in moist, shady environments and is often found in woodland areas or along stream banks.
